rationale: The species has a narrow range (extent of occurrence (EOO) is estimated at around 12,000 km²) and based on its threats from iron mining, commercial logging, and slash and burn agriculture, it is found in fewer than five locations. The species may be found in the Minkebe National Park to the northwest of its known range, but this area is very difficult to sample. If the species were to be found in this area, the species' EOO would still not exceed 20,000 km².
evaluator: Bennett, L., Snoeks, J. & Allen, D.
